title: Agile vs. Lean: Choosing the Right Management Method
content:
Two of the most powerful management philosophies—Agile and Lean—can help teams perform better, depending on the context.

Agile is best when things change fast and feedback is essential. It works well in tech, startups, and innovation.
Lean, on the other hand, focuses on efficiency and eliminating waste. It suits production lines and process-heavy teams.

Key differences:
- Agile = flexible, iterative, adaptable
- Lean = streamlined, efficient, stable

Great leaders know how to combine both approaches depending on goals and culture.
